title: What are the disadvantages of a command economy? - Quora

response.answer_text: The central disadvantage - it has no mechanisms to reallocate resources for better efficiency and is very prone to corruption. The problem with corruption off course - is again malinvestments and inefficiency. However, it can be very efficient at mobilizing resources for reaching specific well designed goals - like building bridges, roads, factories, buildings etc… It is just that the bridges and roads may lean to nowhere, the buildings will be made out of sand and factories will supply stuff without taking care there’s corresponding demand.

Sounds like your homework assignment! The main disadvantage of a command economy is that the desires and needs of the population are extremely complex, and continually changing. A market economy does a much better job of satisfying these needs and desires. The “commander” (some sort of computer aided committee) of a command economy cannot keep up with the complexity.
